alert.note: Alert for Carbon; Lehigh; Monroe; Northampton (Pennsylvania) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 16 at 2:43AM EDT until July 16 at 6:45AM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: The National Weather Service in Mount Holly has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... Lehigh County in eastern Pennsylvania... Northampton County in eastern Pennsylvania... Carbon County in northeastern Pennsylvania... Monroe County in northeastern Pennsylvania... * Until 645 AM EDT. * At 243 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain across the warned area. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. The expected rainfall rate is 0.5 to 1 inch in 1 hour. Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are possible in the warned area. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Flash flooding caused by thunderstorms. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Flooding of small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets, and underpasses as well as other drainage and low lying areas. * Some locations that may experience flash flooding include... Allentown, Easton, Lehighton, Mount Pocono, Bethlehem, Emmaus, Northampton, East Stroudsburg, Tobyhanna, Wilson, Hellertown, and Nazareth. This includes the following highways... Interstate 78 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 46 and 73. Interstate 80 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 277 and 311. Interstate 380 in Pennsylvania between mile markers 0 and 12. Northeast Extension between mile markers 48 and 97. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED EXPECTED RAINFALL RATE...0.5-1 INCH IN 1 HOUR
info.instruction: Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
